intro: Ouratea rhombica, commonly known as the diamondleaf ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, rhombic-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its foliage is evergreen, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The botanical features of Ouratea rhombica make it a notable species in tropical botany and horticulture.
